textBox.richText: Game design resources, Double Ds, RUCA, and the wild wild web

“Do you know what Delta Gamma Delta really stands for? Damn good dancers, that’s what.” -me, playing myself, but blonde, in To Be or Double D (2008) http://www.youtube.com/cecilyrk#p/a/u/0/ZumSB5Rlne0 Why did I drop that little gem? Working on RUCA, or should I say working on working on RUCA, has got me feeling nostalgic about crazy creative endeavors gone by. This project is so big in comparison it is daunting to think about. It is comforting to remember that at the time I began working on To Be or Double D, it felt every bit as challenging. I made it then and I will again. Just a few of the many elements dancing around in my mind right now: game company internships, improving my resume, finishing the RUCA game design document, researching game companies who may be interested in it, seeking alternative grant based means of funding, my application for the Master’s of Communication in Digital Media graduate school program at the University of Washington, my music, my software, the artists I’m promoting, the stop motion video I am making for Laptop Battle, Lorn, Mochipet, and the Great Mundane at Chop Suey tomorrow night, saving the million urls I have open right now because my laptop is starting to ghost a little bit and I’m afraid it might crash and my bookmarks folder is a confusing nightmare. I’m gonna go with last things first so that I may share with you some of the cool resources I have found for anyone designing a game. Women in Games resources page :) http://archives.igda.org/women/resources.html Digital Worlds The Process of Game Creation and the Game Design Document: http://digitalworlds.wordpress.com/2008/04/10/the-process-of-game-creation-the-game-design-document/ Games for Change informational toolkit about the entire game design process: http://gamesforchange.org/toolkitflash/ Writing a design document: http://www.astahost.com/info.php/creating-game-milestone-0-design-phase_t3728.html Adobe template and tutorial on making an interactive design document using InDesign: http://www.adobe.com/designcenter/indesign/articles/print_to_web_02.html Digital Worlds Exploring the world of interactive media and game design (with links to things like example blank design, concept documents, and monomyth checklist): http://digitalworlds.wetpaint.com/ Digital Worlds example blank design document: http://digitalworlds.wetpaint.com/page/Example+Blank+Design+Document Gamasutra Features, all sorts of good stuff about game creation and the games industry in general: http://www.gamasutra.com/php-bin/article_display.php Gamasutra Virtual Economic Theory: How MMOs Really Work: http://www.gamasutra.com/view/feature/6205/virtual_economic_theory_how_mmos_.php Gamasutra How To Pitch Your Project To Publishers: http://www.gamasutra.com/view/feature/6200/how_to_pitch_your_project_to_.php Gamasutra 50 really important accomplishments in gaming from the last year or so: http://www.gamasutra.com/view/feature/6206/the_game_developer_50.php The Seattle Gaming Cluster: http://www.xconomy.com/seattle/2008/09/11/game-on-the-greater-seattle-gaming-cluster/2/ : : insert boner here : : A few more that are my personal faves! Gamasutra State Of The Point-and-Click Art: http://www.gamasutra.com/view/feature/5889/state_of_the_pointandclick_art.php Gamasutra No Truth In Game Design: An Argument For Idolatry: http://www.gamasutra.com/view/feature/5885/no_truth_in_game_design_an_.php Gamasutra article about going deeper with games outside the realm of visual or technological complexity...: http://www.gamasutra.com/view/feature/5880/persuasive_games_plumbing_the_.php Gamasutra The Next Big Steps In Game Sound: http://www.gamasutra.com/view/feature/4257/the_next_big_steps_in_game_sound_.php Gamasutra Truth In Game Design: http://www.gamasutra.com/view/feature/4263/truth_in_game_design.php Gamasutra The Art Of Building Characters: http://www.gamasutra.com/view/feature/4283/the_dust_of_everyday_life_the_art_.php Gamasutra The Deaths of Game Narrative (so good!): http://www.gamasutra.com/view/feature/5952/the_deaths_of_game_narrative.php Gamasutra Sandbox Storytelling: http://www.gamasutra.com/view/feature/6039/the_designers_notebook_sandbox_.php Heuristic Evaluation: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heuristic_evaluation#Nielsen.27s_heuristics Gamasutra Practical Guide to Game Writing: http://www.gamasutra.com/view/feature/6171/a_practical_guide_to_game_writing.php Comment if you know of any other good resources or just to let me know you found some of those helpful!
